page.title: 15St.Matthew's Church Wookey
page.content: St.Matthew's Church reflects two important religious events. In 1635 an order was given by Archbishop Laud, who was concerned to stop the spread of Puritanism, to place communion tables under the east wall of the chancels of all the churches. Bishop Pierce enforced this in his diocese, and Wookey Church seems then to have procured a new altar, which is still used today, and to have put rails before it which are now serving as altar rails in the chapel and are dated 1635. In 1611, King James 1st's new bible, the Authorised Version, was published and a copy of it is still preserved in the church. In 1963 a case to contain it was made by the Somerset Guild of Craftsmen.
